course_title: Core Issues in Global Health: Who Decides the World's Diet?
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 22 / Seats Avail: 9Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: How do you design public health programs so they are effective and sustainable? In this course, we will explore four major steps in program design: planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation, using food fortification (the addition of micronutrients to foods while they are being processed) as a model intervention. (Prerequisite: HLTH 250)
course_description: This course emphasizes core issues in global health, explores the identification of global health priorities, the nature of global health organizations and the challenges to finding and implementing solutions. The focus changes with the instructor
prerequisites: ANT205 or HLTH250 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3777, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: Pachon/Kifer, Status: Open
